The photograph depicts two carousel horses suspended on a merry-go-round, likely captured in motion or between rides. The foreground features a dark horse in rich colors of black, blue, gold, and red, with its head thrown back in a dynamic pose, mouth open as if in mid-neigh. Its eyes are vividly defined, and its mane flows back gracefully.

Behind it, partially obscured, is a second horse painted primarily in white with red and blue accents along the saddle and bridle. This horse also has an open mouth, displaying a playful expression. Both horses have a traditional carnival aesthetic with exaggerated features and vibrant colors.

title: Merry-go-round at an amusement park on St. Simon's Island
